poem:
**The Tariff Shadows**

Two giants, estranged,  
caught in commerce's cruel snare.  
Tariffs rise like walls,  
a sky-high blockade  
of iron currency.  
The stillness, uneasy—  
echoes of war in silent markets,  
where dreams of plenty  
wither in sunless stalls.  
Trade winds stilled,  
while economies ache  
beneath the weight  
of their own ambitions.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Sky-high US-China tariffs are a mutual trade embargo that will hurt both sides Sky-high tariffs that now hang heavily over US-China trade mean, effectively, that they have declared a trade embargo on each other, normally an act of war. The economic consequences for both will hurt. The US’s $150bn (£113bn) or so of exports to China will fall away quickly, while China’s $440bn worth of exports to the US may drop by up to 75%". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
